title: Honoring David Paul Weiss, Esq. upon the occasion of being inducted into the John F. Kennedy High School Hall of Fame
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring David Paul Weiss, Esq. upon the occasion
of being inducted into the John F. Kennedy High School Hall of Fame

WHEREAS, It is the practice of this Legislative Body to take note of and
publicly  acknowledge  individuals of remarkable integrity and character
who have inspired and brought pride to our majestic  Empire  State  with
their strong contributions to the community and model citizenship; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor
David  Paul  Weiss  upon the occasion of being inducted into the John F.
Kennedy High School Hall of Fame; to celebrate this auspicious event,  a
Hall  of  Fame Induction Ceremony and Dinner was held at the high school
on Saturday, November 13, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, David Paul Weiss is a member of the first graduating class of
John F. Kennedy High School (JFK), Class of 1968, which  is  located  in
the Bellmore-Merrick Central High School District (BMCHSD); and
  WHEREAS, He then graduated from Buffalo University and Hofstra Univer-
sity School of Law; and
  WHEREAS,  The backbone of countless organizations and community activ-
ities in Bellmore-Merrick, Attorney David Paul Weiss  provides  pro-bono
legal services as well as active support to people within his community;
he  is  a five-time President and 25-year Member of the Bellmore Chamber
of Commerce Board of Directors and  a  Member  of  the  Bellmore-Merrick
Cultural Arts Foundation Board of Directors; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, David Paul Weiss is the Founder of the JFK Alum-
ni Wrestling Club, an Officer with the JFK Sports Booster Club, an Advi-
sor  for  the  BMCHSD  Scholarship  Program, and a Mentor for the BMCHSD
Senior Experience/Shadow Days; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor David Paul Weiss upon the occasion of being inducted into the John
F.  Kennedy High School Hall of Fame; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to David Paul Weiss, Esq., 2753 Len Drive,  Bellmore,  New  York
11710.
